. Classification of food standards
figure.table:
Dimension
Classification
Goals
Quality: Regulations that provide differentiation of
goods based on content and process attributes not
directly related to health and food safety
Attributes
Content attributes: Regulations that target material
aspects of the food product
Process attributes: Regulations that target the
processes by which a food product is produced,
handled, or
distributed
Breadth
Vertical: Regulations specific to a single product or
closely related products in one or more
stages
of the marketing
chain
Horizontal: Regulations applied across products that
not necessarily closely related
Scope
Uniform: Regulations that apply equally to products
of domestic and foreign origin
